credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Tabernacle and baptismal font.
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
description: Vertical rectangle upon steps, caption "Gradine", stands the tabernacle, shaped like a circular temple, with six columns supporting the entablature, and a door in the wall. Above are moldings, a drum, and a dome with a figure on top. At the foot of the dome stand six hermae or figures, and others similar to them, connected by some object hanging semicircularly. At the right end of the steps is a part of a bowl, with the indication of its height. Caption: "e Fonte battesimale". Beside the dome is written: "per Ciborio"; below, at right, vertically: "57". Colored background.
name: Drawing
